Possible race condition, two threads may race for externalConfigLogged.
externalConfigLogged is set t volatile. This is existing behavior as well. It is just pulled out of compliance config
volatile does not prevent race condition, it only provides memory barrier. It will be OK to file that as an issue and address in a separate PR.

Yes it would be great to address it separately.
Are you saying onNodeStarted will be called by multiple threads ? Need to investigate the race condition

It is a possible race condition. As plugin has no control when and how onNodeStarted() is called, it will be safer to avoid the race condition, especially that it will not cost anything. Just replace volatile with AtomicBoolean and use getAndSet().

Consider:
        this.readEnabledFields = watchedReadFields.stream()
                .map(watchedReadField -> watchedReadField.split(","))
                .filter(split -> split.length != 0)
                .collect(Collectors.toMap(
                        split -> split[0],

                                Collections.singleton("*") : Arrays.stream(split).skip(1).collect(Collectors.toSet())
                ));

nit: please change cache to a more descriptive name.
I don't think that copy/clone is necessary, but if it is, I would rather use Arrays.copyOf().
The array can be modified by some other classes right? Requesting salt will give the modified array.
There are no other classes that modify the array. In this particular case, if you track how salt is used, it will be copied twice.

If you look at MaskedField where you are passing salt16, you are passing the salt to 3rd lib function like this https://github.com/opendistro-for-elasticsearch/security/blob/master/src/main/java/com/amazon/opendistroforelasticsearch/security/configuration/MaskedField.java#L176
You never know if other libs modify the array or not. Is it safer to return a copy and I would prefer doing the same.
Moreover copying salt is current functionality and can changes around this if needed be done separately?

Let me know if you would like to use getComplianceConfig itself or some other name.
getCurrentComplienceConfig() is confusing, IMO. It is just a getter method, it can only get the current value, there is no any other values to get.
Is it necessary to have setComplianceConfig() method? Can it be instantiated inside AbstractAuditLog constructor?
I want to retain this method as subscribing for changes should be as simple as adding @Subscribe to the function.
@Subscribe should not be on the interface method. NullAuditLog should not subscribe to the event bus.
Sorry I meant the function in AuditLogImpl and not this interface method
It should be private. If necessary, there is public getter.
complianceDisabled -> isComplienceConfigEnabled (true -> enabled)
keep public final void route(final AuditMessage msg) and use the most common default to call route(msg, ...)
What do you mean by most common default ?
route(msg, true)

Are you saying to have two functions

route(msg, true)
route(msg) calling the above ?

route(msg) would probably be useful only for tests (which I have updated already). Dont want to add more code to main just for tests.
It is OK to provide a default so that test don't need to be changed.
The tests are already updated

Please consider the following approach:

revert changes to the route() method (it should only take AuditMessage msg as an argument)
introduce a boolean instance variable areRoutesEnabled (false by default).
in route() instead of  isComplianceConfigEnabled use areRoutesEnabled.
rename setupRoutes() to enableRoutes() and make it public
do not call enableRoutes() from AuditMessageRouter constructor, instead, call it from AuditLogImpl if it is enabled and complianceConfig is also enabled

Could you explain the value in doing this and insisting on removing the current change ?
IMO, I see no issue in route(msg, isComplianceConfigEnabled) as it determines what route to take from the audit log based on current compliance configuration for hot reload.
Also would appreciate if you could send the changes in a PR against this branch so that we can quickly move forward :)

The value of the proposal is that

areRoutesEnabled is the state of AuditMessageRouter instance that is simply a delegate of AuditLogImpl, not a parameter for the route() method (that should only take message to route). Such state will be shared by many calls to the route() until there is a state transition.
It is not necessary to initialize routes if routes are not enabled.
Please see https://github.com/sujithvm/security/pull/57

I would prefer AuditMessageRouter improvements to be done separately.
Would appreciate if you could share your changes :) Dont want to trigger another set of changes around this.
The improvements to AuditMessageRouter are minimal, but it is necessary to keep original route() to take message as the only parameter.
